transcript.sentence: At computer keyboards, a black hand types on the left, a white hand types on the right.
A woman in an office drinking coffee on both sides of split screens. She is reviewing resumes.
Thousands of resumes were mailed to employers. They were identical except for the names
dante and left and david on right are highlighted on the resumes.
Black sounding names were 50% less likely to be called back.
In split screens, dante and david shake hands with the same man standing next to a car. Great deals low prices.
Close up of the car dealer who gives a curt nod on the left
and a bigger smile and not on the right.
Don t and david smile as they drive their cars.
Large house with a for sale sign. City view.
Split screen with mirror images of different coffee mugs.
They type up resumes, print and mail them.
Street with parked and driving cars, jeep and hund a signs and a waving tube man.
The car dealer hands each a clipboard with a sales agreement.
Black people are charged prices roughly $700 higher than white people when buying cars.
Dante signs at $10700. David signs at $10000.
David continues driving don tape holes over
a cop approaches enhance him a ticket.
Multiple studies show black drivers are twice as likely to get pulled over.
Split screen of the block with three houses on left. Don t stands on the sidewalk by a 1 story house with an open house sign talking to a man.
Dante points next door to a 2 story house that also has an open house sign. The man shakes know and points to the one story.
On, right? The man walks with david, pointing to the two story house.
Black clients are shown 17.7% fewer houses for sale.
Many screens, people of all races, smoking marijuana at parties. And individually, marijuana use is equal between blacks and whites. Yet black people are four times more likely to be arrested.
Smoke leaves a white mouth, while black men are arrested.
A black man is held against a jail cell by many white cops.
Black people are incarcerated at nearly six times the rate of white people.
Split screen. Senator jim Smith is on a nameplate on a dusk by a small American flag.
Jim is seated at the desk wearing a suit and tie.
To human hearts rotate. Doctors did not inform black patients as often as white ones about an important heart procedure.
Jim sets down his cell phone and sees an EMAIL from dante. Please increase school funding.
He'd elites without reading.
White legislators did not respond as frequently to constituents with black sounding names in both political parties.
Jim returns to his cell phone.
Looking down at shoes, walking on sidewalk, then side few split screen. Dante walks from left screen into the right.
Split screen, dante and david looking both directions simultaneously. Then straight ahead, david smiles slightly.
Dante and david are centered on the screen, with half of their bodies visible behind them. The earlier scenes, we play in a blur.

what is?
Fade to black than half black, half white racism isn't over.
Sign the pledge to fight back. Brave new films dot org slash racism.
Studies referenced in order of appearance resume study. University of chicago field study experiment on racial bias in hiring by marianne bertrand 2003
buying a car study new york times economic review racial bias even when we have good intentions by cent. Il miller nathan 2015.
Pull over studies aclu special report driving while black racial profiling on our nation's highways,
racial profiling, prohibition project traffic stop data analysis, 2013 to 2014.
USA today arrest rates study FBI arrest records analysis, 2014
US department of justice police behavior during traffic and street stops. 2011
kalamazoo department of public safety traffic stop data analysis project 2013.
Buying a house study. The federal department of housing and urban development, housing discrimination against racial and ethnic minorities. 2012
arrested for drugs study
American civil liberties union, the war on marijuana in black and white 2013
incarceration rate study,
the sentencing project, uneven justice state rates of incarceration by race and ethnicity by mark mauer and ryan s king 2007.
Doctor study the new England journal of medicine, the effect of race and sex on physician's recommendations for cardiac catheter rise Asian 1999
politician response study yale university field experiment.
Do politicians racially discriminate against constituents by butler and brookman? 2011.

result.title: Racism Is Real • BRAVE NEW FILMS
result.description:
The Baltimore Uprising is a symptom of a much larger problem!  SIGN THE PLEDGE TO FIGHT RACISM: http://www.bravenewfilms.org/racism SUBSCRIBE http://bit.ly/1JUX3Xv  WATCH OUR FEATURE FILMS FREE: http://bit.ly/1JUX3Xv WATCH MORE: http://bit.ly/1GxWnUe

Something is wrong when thousands of resumes are mailed to employers with identical information and black-sounding names are 50% less likely to get a call back.  Something is wrong when black people are charged prices roughly $700 higher than white people when buying cars.  Something is wrong when black drivers are twice as likely to get pulled over by the police and black male teens are 21 times more likely to be killed by cops than their white counterparts. Something is wrong when black people are incarcerated at nearly six times the rate of white people.

And something is wrong when we continue to NOT do anything about it!
SIGN THE PLEDGE TO FIGHT RACISM http://www.bravenewfilms.org/racism

Educators: use this film in your classroom! http://www.bravenewfilms.org/educators

Facebook:  http://www.Facebook.com/BraveNewFilms
Instagram:  http://www.Instagram.com/BraveNewFilms
Twitter:  http://www.twitter.com/BraveNewFilms

DONATE:  https://bravenew.nationbuilder.com/donate

WATCH OUR FULL FILMS FREE + NEW VIDEOS ALMOST EVERY WEEKDAY: http://bit.ly/1JUX3Xv

Set up a free screening or house party for any of our films free: http://www.bravenewfilms.org/screenings

ABOUT BRAVE NEW FILMS
Robert Greenwald and Brave New Films are at the forefront of the fight to create a just America. Using new media and internet video campaigns, Brave New Films has created a quick-strike capability that informs the public, challenges corporate media with the truth, and motivates people to take action on social issues nationwide. Brave New Films’ investigative films have scrutinized the impact of U.S. drone strikes; the war on whistleblowers; and Wal Mart’s corporate practices.
